Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black with band in added red; exterior: on top of rim, lotus bud frieze with dots in interstices; on outside of rim, double ivy leaf frieze; neck glazed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 127, pl. XXXIX, no. 354.1)
CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 5-6, pl. 108, no. 13-14)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 233, no. 194)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0972)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4765 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
